title: Refining Semantic Segmentation with Superpixels using Transparent Initialization and Sparse Encoder

sections.network architectures:
We use the state-of-the-art DeepLabV3+  and
ResNeSt [ref]54 for semantic segmentation and the state-of-the-art superpixels
with FCN [ref]52 for superpixel contours. DeepLabV3+ achieves high and robust performance with atrous spatial
pyramid pooling for multiscale feature maps and
encoder-decoder modules for deep features with
different output strides.
It is widely used as a network backbone for semantic segmentation due to these
well-studied modules evaluated by empirical experiments.
ResNeSt [ref]54 replaces ResNet with multiscale scores using softmax-based feature map attention and achieves the new state-of-the-art.
The loss function for semantic segmentation is the standard
cross-entropy loss of predicted logits and ground truth labelling.
Readers can refer  [ref]54 for more details. Superpixel with FCN [ref]52 is the current state-of-the-art superpixel network.
The core idea is to construct a distance-based loss function with
aggregations of neighbouring pixel and superpixel properties and
locations.
This is similar to the SLIC method , where the property
vectors can be CIELAB colors or one-hot semantic encoding.
